content: What type of bird, also a symbol of peace, did Noah release from the Ark to see if the flood waters had receded?

The bird that Noah released from the Ark to check if the floodwaters had receded is a dove. In the biblical story, Noah sent out a dove several times. First, it returned because the waters still covered the Earth. Later, when it brought back an olive leaf, Noah knew that the waters had subsided enough for him to emerge from the Ark. The dove has since become a symbol of peace and new beginnings, often associated with messages of hope and resolution.
